intro: Illicium wangii, commonly known as the Hainan star anise, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Hainan Island in China. It belongs to the family Schisandraceae and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped fruits that resemble those of star anise. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers and has compound leaves with a serrated margin. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in undergrowth vegetation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
